I was born outside of the U.S., but I am a U.S. Citizen because one or both of my parents was a U.S. Citizen. How do I get certification of my birth and citizenship?
Prepare a written (or typed) request. Include all of the following: 
WHO CAN I CALL FOR HELP?
Get your request notarized by a Notary Public. 
Prepare a check or money order for $50 (no cash). Make it payable to “Department of State.” Mail your request and fee. Address the envelope to: Department of State, Passport Vital Records Sections1150 Passport Services Pl, 6th FloorDulles, VA 20189-1150.[36]

title: How do I know if I need to apply for a passport in person or if I can apply by mail?
heading_text:
How do I know if I need to apply for a passport in person or if I can apply by mail?
How do I apply in person for a new U.S. Passport? 
Put together the required information and documents. 
A NOTE ABOUT EMERGENCIES:
Obtain and Complete the Application (Form DS-11).
Get a passport photo taken and pay for 2 copies.[225] 
Go to your local Passport Office or Passport Acceptance Facility with all your documents (see PG. 71 to learn how to find a location near you), submit your application, and pay the fees. 
Receive your passport in 4-6 weeks, and make a reminder about when it needs to be renewed.[228]
How do I apply by mail for a renewal of my U.S. Passport? 
Make sure you’re eligible and prepared to renew your passport. This means: 
Put together the required documents. 
Complete and sign the application form (DS-82).[232] 
Get 2 passport photos taken.[233]
Pay the fee.
Mail your renewal application materials. 
Receive your passport in 4-6 weeks, and set up a reminder to yourself about when it needs to be renewed.[237]

title: How do I get a tribal ID card?
heading_text:
How do I get a tribal ID card?
First, you need the name of the tribe to which you are returning.The best next step is to call or write your tribe’s enrollment department, and ask if they have enrollment forms and instructions; if so, ask them to send these to you.Send the tribe as many details as possible about your family history and tribal ancestry (and if applicable, use the forms they sent you).
Contact the tribe’s enrollment department directly, and they will likely be able to assist you in a getting a copy of your tribal ID card.Follow any instructions given to you by the tribe.

title: How do I register to vote in California? What is the application process?
heading_text:
How do I register to vote in California? What is the application process?
Registering through the ONLINE form:
Go to the online form.
Complete the online form. 
Submit the online form.
Wait to hear from for your county elections office. 
Registering with the PAPER form:
Get the paper form. There are a few different ways to get it:
Complete the paper form. 
Submit the paper form. Mail it to your county elections office, or drop it off in person.Wait to hear from for your county elections office. It will contact you if it approves your voter registration, or if it needs more information to confirm that you can vote.[270]

FIRST, YOU SHOULD MAKE CONTACT WITH YOUR PAROLE AGENT AND VISIT YOUR ASSIGNED PAROLE OFFICE.
IF ANY CRIMES ARE COMMITTED AGAINST YOU AFTER YOUR RELEASE, TELL YOUR PAROLE AGENT.
IF YOU ARE STOPPED BY THE POLICE, TELL YOUR PAROLE AGENT.

I WAS IN CDCR’s CUSTODY FOR LESS THAN 6 MONTHS DUE TO A PAROLE VIOLATION. DO I GET GATE MONEY WHEN I AM RELEASED?
GATE MONEY (a.k.a. “RELEASE ALLOWANCE”):
> $200 GATE MONEY:
> IF YOU ALREADY RECEIVED A $100 ADVANCE, you ONLY get $100 IN gate money
> YOU WILL NOT RECEIVE YOUR GATE MONEY IF YOU ARE RELEASED FROM PRISON INTO THE CUSTODY OF ANOTHER AGENCY THAT IS DETAINING YOU
> YOU WILL “FORFEIT” (GIVE UP) YOUR RIGHT TO GATE MONEY IN THE FOLLOWING SITUATION
> YOU HAVE NO RIGHT TO GATE MONEY IN THE FOLLOWING SITUATION

The supervising agency (the county probation department) then has two weeks to send any information it received from CDCR before you were released to the probation department in your new county of permanent residence.[669]Once the new county’s probation department has verified your permanent residency in its county, the agency must accept you on PRCS there.[670]

title: How can I challenge a court decision revoking my PRCS, or a decision by the hearing officer after a PRCS violation hearing?
heading_text:
How can I challenge a court decision revoking my PRCS, or a decision by the hearing officer after a PRCS violation hearing?
To appeal, you must file a notice of appeal in the county Superior Court within 60 calendar days after the court’s decision.[679]After a timely notice of appeal is filed, the Superior Court will prepare a record of the PRCS revocation proceedings that includes all the documents filed in the court and transcripts of the hearings. The Superior Court must then provide these documents to (1) the Court of Appeal, (2) the State/ District Attorney (representing the Probation Department), and (3) you. In a direct appeal, the court of appeal must appoint an attorney to represent you for free if you don’t have enough money to pay for one.[680] In order to have a court-appointed attorney, you must file your notice of appeal within 60 calendar days after the court’s decision.

Notify your Probation Officer that you want to change your address, and submit that address and the contact information for anyone else living at that address. You must get permission from your Probation Officer to move within your current U.S. Probation District—even if it’s across the street.Your Probation Officer will investigate the new address—so long as it is located in the same U.S. Probation District. BAN 3: Past Eviction for Drug-Related Activity on Federal Government-Assisted Property  Minimum 3-year Ban for Three Federal Government-Assisted Housing Programs

title: How do I apply for the California LifeLine program?
heading_text:
How do I apply for the California LifeLine program?
First select a participating telephone company. If you already use a specific phone company, it may already participate in the LifeLine program (you can call the company and ask), or you may select a new telephone company that serves your area by searching online at: https://www.californialifeline.com/en/provider_search.
The telephone company will give you a Lifeline application form, with an Enrollment Code and/or a Personal Identification Number (PIN) in a pink envelope. To view a copy of a sample California LifeLife application form, go to https://www.californialifeline.com/pdf/new/applications/st_en_10_app_0114.pdf.In order to receive the California LifeLine benefits, you must complete this form, sign it, and send it to the California LifeLine Administrator along with any required documents by the due date listed on the form. You may also apply online at https://www.californialifeline.com/en/login

My PARENTAL RIGHTS WERE TERMINATED WHILE I WAS INCARCERATED. what can i do?
Speak to an attorney about appealing. If your parental rights were terminated recently, you may be able to appeal. For example, if you did not get advance notice of a hearing at which you had the right to be present, and the hearing resulted in an unfavorable decision, your absence at the hearing may be grounds for an appeal.[2355] You should speak to an attorney about your particular circumstances to see whether an appeal is an appropriate solution. If your child has not been adopted, he or she may be able to file a 388 petition to reinstate your parental rights. This remedy may be available under two circumstances: if your child hasn’t been adopted within three years of the termination of your parental rights, OR, regardless of how much time has passed, if both your child and the social service agency agree that adoption is unlikely. See PG. X for more information about 388 petitions. 
My child was placed in foster care while i was incarcerated. what can i do to reconnect?
First, you should get in contact with Child Protective Services (“CPS”) as soon as you are incarcerated and tell them where you are and that you want to be involved as soon as there is a case regarding your child.Second, you have a right to be present and represented by a lawyer at all of the following hearings:
Third, most important for you will be the disposition hearing, where the court will decide what you need to do to reunify with your child. CPS will write a case plan that you must follow if you want to reunify with your child upon your release.. At this hearing you can request that the court order several ways to keep in contact with your child including:
Finally, the court will be more likely to return your child to you during Status Review Hearings if you:

title: FAMILY & CHILDREN APPENDIX
heading_text:
HELPFUL HINTSAssistance, Forms, & Fees in Family Court
File all of the necessary forms with the family court to join or start a new case. Depending on the court, you may have to file your court forms in personOnce you receive notice from the family court that your forms were acceptable, you must serve a copy of the forms you filed as well as a response form on the person you are bringing a court case against in family court, usually here it will be your child’s other parent. When a case in family court is first filed, it must be personally served on the other party or parties. This means that you cannot mail the forms, but have to find someone to hand deliver the forms to whomever you are suing. This is called “service of process.” Any adult over the age of 18 can do this for you. Form more information on service of process in family court, see . Once the family court accepts your forms and you serve the papers on the other party or parties in the case, the judge in family court will order one, two or all three of the following: Schedule a hearing you must attend and/or Require you and the other parent to attend a mediationAnd/or order a custody evaluation.
